name: Mount Moriah

trails_config.name: Carter-Moriah Trail (Stony Brook)
trails_config.description: A pleasant approach from Gorham: follow Stony Brook Trail and then Carter-Moriah Trail through mixed woods. The upper mountain features series of granite ledges including the famous ledge at Mt Surprise, offering fantastic views north to the Presidentials. The final summit of Moriah has an open ledge with panoramic views over the Carter range and Androscoggin valley. This route’s moderate grades and rewarding viewpoints make it a favorite dayhike in the area.

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of New Hampshire on Mount Moriah. At 4049 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4049 feet, Mount Moriah is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Carter-Moriah Trail (Stony Brook)**, a **9.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Middle Carter Mountain**, which is just 3.5 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
